body:
Hey there. Today i am introducing a new tournament, it's called: Bloodthirsty,


This tournament will be TDM. I'm doing this to train for the upcoming official tournament. As far as we know, it will be TDM so why not? Let's start.


System: 3 Game Guarantee


Gamemode: TDM

Roster Sizes: 8v8 (6 minimum players)

  • You may use substitute players as long as they are not already playing on a team that is in this tournament.

Bracket & Schedule:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1q55qBRrA-iM0_az26-rN7E0wJtsGp-4BFMnwcv8y6jc/edit#gid=0


*This will be updated regularly, it is your responsibility to check this out regularly. Updates will be posted on here as well.


Map Pool: [7 maps]

  • Injustice

  • Emperial

  • Xena

  • Actrix

  • Supply

  • Plaza

  • Lutose

Map Veto:

  • Best of 3

  1. Team A will veto one map.

  2. Team B will veto one map.

  3. Team A will choose one map.

  4. Team B will choose one map.

  5. Team A will veto one map.

  6. Team B will veto one map.

  7. The last remaining map will be played if necessary.

  • Best of 5 (Finals)

  1. Team A will veto one map.

  2. Team B will veto one map.

  3. Team A will pick one map.

  4. Team B will pick one map.

  5. Team A will pick one map.

  6. Team B will pick one map.

  7. The last map that hasn't been vetoed or chosen will be counted as the default win.

==================================================================================


Tournament Staff


Event Coordinators: PokerFace & Bloodoh


Officials: Kyoal, Iron, Fluenza_, Saayah.


Referees: iScaglia, pashaabiceps & ShinnyGaming, TehSkilled, Stimulating, PieZ, Maatih, Veopth, StormzInvader,                 DaFrozenBlaze


Streamers: SoccerMaster89, awesome_apricot, LFT

replies.body:
MATCH SCHEDULE HAS BEEN RELEASED

Hello everyone the match schedule has finally been released! As I promised to all of you, the time is reasonable for each and every team participating. According to the preferred timezone given by your team leaders, nobody should be playing past 12:00 MIDNIGHT or earlier than 6:00AM. To view the schedule just go to the bracket document and look at the first sheet. You will see it on the right side of the bracket. 

Things to Consider:
  • The winner of game #1 (Big Boyz vs. Baller Boys) will play immediately after that game is finished against China Baby Toes. There will be a few minutes of break in between these 2 games, depending on how fast the game goes.
  • Some games may say Saturday according to GMT time, but it could very well be a Sunday in your timezone.
  • The time that is next to your team name is the time that you will be playing according to the timezone that your team leader gave me. If your timezone is not the same as the one that your team leader gave to me, please talk to your team leader to figure out what time it is.
  • On Sheet 3 of the spreadsheet, there is a timetable for all of the teams. You can use this to see how I came up with the times of the matches.
If there are any mistakes please let me know!

Maps: 
  • Injustice has been added to the map pool.
  • In the event that Plaza, Lutose, and Emperial are not ready by the time the first matches start, we will be left with Actrix, Supply, Sentry, and Injustice. (4 maps). A new veto system may have to be created later on.
  • If worst comes to worst and we do not have at least 5 of the planned maps to be used in this tournament, we will add in a "Wildcard map". This map will be a completely random TDM map (Not Nexus) that is available on the Avicus repository. You may choose to veto the "Wildcard map" if you like, but you may risk vetoing a map that your team is strong at. 
Servers:
  • If the developers allow us to use the official servers, we will use them. If not, we will contact each team to book scrim servers at a designated time.
Good luck and have fun everyone! 

Edit:
  • The time for Eternal Cross vs. Cronus has switched from 11PM GMT to 2PM GMT.
  • The time for Big Boyz vs. Baller Boyz has switched from 3PM GMT to 7PM GMT

You may choose to veto the "Wildcard map" if you like, but you may risk vetoing a map that your team is strong at. 
Servers:
  • If the developers allow us to use the official servers, we will use them. If not, we will contact each team to book scrim servers at a designated time.
Good luck and have fun everyone! 

Edit:
  • The time for Eternal Cross vs. Cronus has switched from 11PM GMT to 2PM GMT.
  • The time for Big Boyz vs. Baller Boyz has switched from 3PM GMT to 7PM GMT

replies.body:
UPDATE:

Map Pool:

-Since many of the maps encountered issues with the YML's, we will be having a different map pool. There will be 5 maps to choose from for the Week 1 matches. We hope to add on the other maps later.

For now the map pool consists of:
  • Actrix TE
  • Supply TE
  • Sentry TE
  • Injustice TE
  • Mirage (Wildcard map)
Map Veto:

1. Team A will veto one map.
2. Team B will veto one map.
3. Team A will choose one map to be played first from the remaining 3 maps.
4. Team B will choose one map to be played second from the remaining 2 maps.
5. The last map remaining will be played third if necessary.

Good luck have fun!

Edit: Do not spawn camp on Mirage. Any team caught doing so will result in a forfeit for that game. (Starting from after the Apollo vs.Xenarch game).

replies.body:
Recap:

Game #1: Qrysis defeated Endless Aptitude 2-0. 
  • Supply: [100-31]
  • Injustice: [100-59]
Game #2: CBT defeated Qrysis 2-0.
  • Actrix: [85-51]
  • Supply: [100-34]
Game #3: Eternal Cross defeated Cronus 2-0.
  • Actrix: [91-9]
  • Injustice [90-29]
Game #4: Apollo defeated Xenarch 2-0.
  • Supply: [100-12]
  • Mirage: [29-12]
Game #5: Cacalmarin defeated Sagrevyum 2-0. 
  • Supply: [0-1] (Sagrevyum had a ban evader which led them to forfeit Map #1).
  • Actrix: [54-78]
Highlights:
  •  Qrysis impressed many viewers on Actrix against CBT. The game started off very close, but CBT pulled away slowly near the end. 
  • Cacalmarin was the only team who had beat a team with a higher seed than them. 
Things to consider:
  • We will be changing the map pool for next week as a few of the newer maps are finally coming together. The veto process may change as well.
  • Times will be announced sometime during this week. 
Other than that, good luck to all teams next week! Even if you lose your 2nd match, you will not be eliminated yet!

replies.body:
UPDATE:

Schedule: 
  • The schedule for the Week 2 matches has been posted! You will find it on the same spreadsheet, just click on the tab on the bottom that says Schedule. The GMT time and date is provided as well as the the time according to the timezone provided by your leader (I converted the times for you :D).
  • Just a little note, some of the times became a little bit unreasonable. This is because there are lots of matches in the losers bracket and if we continued the tournament with just one match a week, this would take over a month. However, the times are still reasonable enough. Most teams will not be affected by this. 
  • Some of the matches that will be played don't have the assigned teams yet. That is because it depends on the results of the previous games. It is important that you know when the next match is as some may be back-to-back depending on the results.
Eliminations: 
  • This week, there will be 3 teams from the Loser's bracket eliminated. The 5 teams in the Loser's bracket will be fighting for one of the two spots at Game #14 or Game #15 against the losers of Game #12 and Game #13. Games #14-17 will happen the week after. 
  • Basically, if you are in the loser's bracket and you lose your 3rd, 4th, or 5th game, you will be eliminated from the tournament. The four teams in the winner's bracket regardless of the results are safe for another week and are guaranteed 6th place. 
Maps: 
  • All of the maps currently listed in the map pool are finalized except for:
    • Lutose
    • Emperial
  • We will let you know if these maps are not ready to go by the time of next week's matches. 
Good luck and have fun at Week 2 of the BloodThirsty TM! 

*Also, if you haven't already, you should subscribe to the forum post :p

replies.body:
Week 4 Schedule:

Congratulaions China Baby Toes and Sagrevyum for reaching the finals! Even though there were lots of default wins and conflicts, I hope everybody had fun while it lasted! 

The finals will on May 7th, Saturday at 5:00 PM GMT. The conversions are listed on the spreadsheet for your convenience. 

Additional Game Rules:
  • No spawn camping even if there aren't regions. 
  • No intentionally dying by natural causes to avoid death from the enemy.
Spectating:

To bring in some excitement to the finals, the officials of this event have decided to allow all players who want, to spectate the match. There are some rules to this however.

Spectator Rules: 
  • No spreading tactical information. (Doing so will result in a punishment, logs can be checked.)
  • You may only talk in spectator chat while the game is in progression. 
  • You may not be in a team's TS room. 
Good luck to Sagrevyum and China Baby Toes next week! China Baby Toes will start with the 1-0 advantage.
